CONNECTING STUDENTS AND STARTUPS

October 1, 2016 at Brown University

Connect and work
with innovative startups

Startup@Brown is a day-long conference on Saturday, Oct. 1 at Brown University that brings together innovative startups and talented students.

Come to learn about startups and their stories. Leave with a new perspective and your next summer internship or full-time job.

Speakers include trailblazing founders, entrepreneurs, and venture capitalists.

    Co-Founder and CEO, Apropose Inc.

    Director of Product Management, Delphix

Startup Fair

Walk around, meet with startups and learn about their work, challenges, and career opportunities.

Small Group Conversations

Sit down with startup leaders and 10-12 other students in an intimate and lively discussion. Ask them anything!

Workshops

Learn about everything from scaling your tech stack to starting a company as a student.

Meet the amazing startups and VC firms
that participated in Startup@Brown 2015.

FAQs

Who can attend Startup@Brown?

All Brown and RISD undergraduate and graduate students are welcome to apply. A background in computer science, design, engineering, or business is recommended but not required!

Student Startups from other colleges are welcome too. Apply to be one of the 20 student startups here. Startups will have office hours with the startup leaders and venture capitalists attending, a chance to demo their project, and a table to get feedback & find collaborators.

Why Startup@Brown?

As Brown students, while we get a lot of exposure to larger companies, we don’t often hear about the exciting work startups do and the challenges they face. At Startup@Brown, you’ll get the chance to talk in small groups with founders, engineering leads, and venture capitalists from Andreessen Horowitz, Y Combinator, Teespring, and more. Come to learn about startups and their stories. Leave with a new perspective and your next summer internship or full-time job.

What will the event be like?

Startup@Brown is a day-long event where you’ll have the chance to interact closely with startup founders, many of them alumni.

The event will start with a fair, introducing you to 15 startups, and then split into small-group conversations and workshops like “What is Product Management” to “Exploring Accelerators.” Meet with engineers and designers, discuss the technical problems they’re trying to solve, and maybe they'll interest you enough for an internship or job :).

How do I apply?

Register for Startup@Brown 2016 here!

When will I find out if I'm accepted?

We'd love if everyone could attend, but we usually receive way more interest than the space available. We'll tell you if you have a spot by September 17th.
